subject.normal: StarBeast: gives me an error when I increase chainlength in the xml file

headers.subject: StarBeast: gives me an error when I increase chainlength in the xml file
headers.received: by ywa6 with SMTP id 6sf2727922ywa.15 for <google.larry.sergey@a.markmail.org>; Mon, 20 Dec 2010 10:37:38 -0800 (PST)
by z9g2000yqz.googlegroups.com with HTTP; Mon, 20 Dec 2010 10:31:53 -0800 (PST)
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13,gzip(gfe)

body.para: I created an xml file in Beauti. The chainLength was 1000000000. It ran smoothly in Beast (v1.6.1). However, the ESSs were low for many parameters and the operator analysis suggested some changes to several scale factors. I made the changes to the scale factors in the xml and it is running fine in Beast. I would like to run it longer, but I tried adding a zero to the chainLength parameter in the xml file, and Beast gives me an error stating that it needs a an integer for that parameter. I also tried adding a zero to all the sampling frequency parameters, but it still doesn't work.
Any help with this would be appreciated,
